cry.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to produce tears from your eyes, usually because you are unhappy or hurt
cry.translation[0].definitions[0].note.t: cry yourself to sleep (=cry until you fall asleep)
cry.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Don’t cry, Laura. It’ll be OK.
Upstairs, a baby began to cry.
Jamie looked like he’d been crying.
That film always makes me cry.
Oliver, alone, began to cry bitterly (=cry a lot).
I am too old to be crying over some young guy.
She felt like crying with frustration.
She could hear him crying for his mother.
cry.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to shout or say something loudly
cry.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: It was painful, and made me cry aloud.
I could hear voices crying for help.
cry.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: if animals or birds cry, they make a loud sound
cry.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: I could hear gulls crying and the soft whisper of the sea.
cry.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: The end of the book was so sad that it made me cry.
Eventually, he stopped crying and told me what happened.
I feel like crying every time I think about that day.
Lucy read the letter and cried her eyes out.
I cried like a baby when I heard the news.
That night he cried himself to sleep.
She fell on her bed, crying loudly.
People sat crying softly among the wreckage.
When I looked at Jane, I saw that she was crying silently.
I no longer felt brave or strong, and I began to cry bitterly.
They were crying uncontrollably at the sight of his grave.
cry.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: cry
to produce tears from your eyes
Don’t cry – everything will be all right!
Men aren’t supposed to cry.
cry your eyes out
to cry a lot and for a long time
I cried my eyes out when I watched ‘Titanic’.
be in tears
to be crying
By the end of his story, we were all in tears.
be close to tears
to be almost crying
You could see that she was close to tears.
weep
to cry, especially for a long time
His mother put her head on the table and wept.
sob
to cry, taking sudden loud breaths
I could hear someone sobbing in the next room.
wail
to cry very loudly in a high voice
The baby started wailing for its mother.
whimper
to cry quietly and weakly
She began rocking to and fro, whimpering softly.
hold/fight back the tears
to make a big effort not to cry
She told her story, struggling to hold back the tears.
your eyes water
if your eyes water, they have tears in them, for example because of smoke, wind, or when you are cutting onions
The onions were making my eyes water.
to start crying
burst into tears
to suddenly start crying
The man shouted at her and she burst into tears.
break down
to start crying after trying hard not to cry, especially when talking about something very upsetting
He broke down and begged for forgiveness.
When I saw what had happened to him, I just broke down and cried.
cry.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: a loud sound expressing a strong emotion such as pain, fear, or pleasure
cry.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Alice let out a cry of alarm.
The stone hit him on the forehead and he gave a sharp cry.
cry.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: At last, there was a cry of ‘Silence!’, and everyone looked towards the door.
Fortunately, a passerby heard his cries for help.
cry.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: a period of time during which tears come out of your eyes, usually because you are unhappy
cry.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: It’s good to have a cry sometimes.
I felt much better after I’d had a good cry (=cried for a long time).
cry.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: a phrase that is used to unite people in support of a particular action or idea
cry.translation[1].definitions[3].exampl: ‘Land and Liberty’ was the rallying cry of revolutionary Mexico.
cry.translation[1].definitions[4].defini: a sound made by a particular animal
cry.translation[1].note_box[0].sections[: A rock was loose and he fell with a sharp cry of surprise.
A cry escaped her lips as he tightened his grip on her wrist.
The woman looked up and gave a cry of fear.
Seeing the fields and mountains, she let out a cry of delight.
The child gave a small cry and burst into tears.
With a great cry they charged into battle.
He gave a sharp cry of pain.
I heard a long, low cry of despair.
The girl gave a stifled cry of disappointment.
I thought I heard a muffled cry from somewhere in the building.
She gave an anguished cry, calling his name.
